CN.content:
Please identify the "Material Name" entities in the following paragraph.

Paragraph: A novel conjugated polymer of PBDT-TDPP-S was synthesized , which contains a donor unit of benzo [1,2b:4,5-b′]dithiophene in main chain and an acceptor unit of diketopyrrolopyrrole in side chain. This kind of side - chain donor - acceptor ( D-A ) polymer exhibited better solution processability , lower HOMO level ( -5.34 eV ) , and more balanced carrier mobility relative to its corresponding mainchain D-A conjugated polymers. Using PBDT-TDPP-S as electron donor and [6,6]-phenyl-C 71 -butyric acid methyl ester ( PC71BM ) as electron acceptor , the resulting polymer solar cells exhibited outstanding photovoltaic properties with a power conversion efficiency of 4.89% , an open - circuit voltage of 0.84 V , a short - circuit current of 10.04 mA cm^-2 , and a fill factor of 56.0% . Bulk heterojunction ( BHJ ) polymer solar cells ( PSCs ) have attracted significant attention because of their potential for achieving large - area , flexible photovoltaic devices through lowcost solution processing techniques. 1 To date , solar power conversion efficiencies ( PCE ) of 10.6% and 9.2% have been demonstrated in the cells with tandem and single junction structures , respectively , representing an important advance in the development of PSCs. 2 Many recent research efforts have been concentrated on the development of donor - acceptor ( D-A ) narrow band gap ( NBG ) polymers with broad absorption spectra. 3 Despite the great success of these D-A polymers in achieving high performance PSCs , further development of novel electron donor polymers is still in urgent need as the donor polymers play a decisive role in determining the device performance. Nowadays , most of the present polymers are in main - chain D-A frame , which may suffer from lower hole mobility due to the influence of acceptor units in the main chain. Aiming at investigating the effects of the D-A framework on device performance , Huang and co-workers proposed a new molecular design strategy toward side - chain D-A conjugated polymers , in which D moieties were employed to construct the main chain and A units were conjugatedly pended onto the D units in the side chain. 4 Compared to the corresponding main - chain D-A polymers , the side - chain ones mainly possesses three advantages. First , the highest occupied molecular orbit ( HOMO ) energy levels of the side - chain polymers can preserve in a deeper position. Second , a two - dimensional - like structural feature renders this class of polymers with better solubility. Finally , there exists an internal charge transfer ( ICT ) behavior from the side - chain D-A structure , which can fine - tune the band gap ( E g ) of the resultant polymers as well as promote an isotropic charge transport along the polymeric main chain. As a result of these merits , PSCs based on these previously reported side - chain D-A polymers exhibited a maximal PCE of 4.74% .

Let's think step by step.

1. First, let's identify the Material Names in the paragraph that are not polymers:

* [6,6]-phenyl-C71-butyric acid methyl ester (PC71BM)

This is a small molecule, not a polymer.

1. Next, let's identify the polymers in the paragraph:

* PBDT-TDPP-S
* PSCs (polymer solar cells)
* BHJ (bulk heterojunction) polymer solar cells
* D-A polymers (donor-acceptor polymers)
* NBG (narrow band gap) polymers

1. Now, let's identify the Material Names that are polymers and are mentioned as having specific properties or functions:

* PBDT-TDPP-S (synthesized polymer with a donor unit of benzo[1,2b:4,5-b′]dithiophene in the main chain and an acceptor unit of diketopyrrolopyrrole in the side chain)
* PC71BM (electron acceptor)

1. Finally, let's identify the Material Names that are polymers and are mentioned as being used in the fabrication of devices:

* PBDT-TDPP-S (used as electron donor in polymer solar cells)
* PC71BM (used as electron acceptor in polymer solar cells)

Therefore, the Material Names that are polymers and are mentioned as having specific properties or functions are:

* PBDT-TDPP-S
* PC71BM

The Material Names that are polymers and are mentioned as being used in the fabrication of devices are:

* PBDT-TDPP-S
* PC71BM
Please remove irrelevant entities and only keep the entities that clearly refer to Material Name.

Sure, here's the updated list of Material Names mentioned in the text:

1. PBDT-TDPP-S
2. PC71BM

Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Material Name".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

Sure, here's a Markdown table with the valid Material Names mentioned in the paragraph:

| Material Name |
| --- |
| PBDT-TDPP-S |
| PC71BM |

PN.content:
Please identify the Property Names of materials in the following paragraph.

Paragraph: A novel conjugated polymer of PBDT-TDPP-S was synthesized , which contains a donor unit of benzo [1,2b:4,5-b′]dithiophene in main chain and an acceptor unit of diketopyrrolopyrrole in side chain. This kind of side - chain donor - acceptor ( D-A ) polymer exhibited better solution processability , lower HOMO level ( -5.34 eV ) , and more balanced carrier mobility relative to its corresponding mainchain D-A conjugated polymers. Using PBDT-TDPP-S as electron donor and [6,6]-phenyl-C 71 -butyric acid methyl ester ( PC71BM ) as electron acceptor , the resulting polymer solar cells exhibited outstanding photovoltaic properties with a power conversion efficiency of 4.89% , an open - circuit voltage of 0.84 V , a short - circuit current of 10.04 mA cm^-2 , and a fill factor of 56.0% . Bulk heterojunction ( BHJ ) polymer solar cells ( PSCs ) have attracted significant attention because of their potential for achieving large - area , flexible photovoltaic devices through lowcost solution processing techniques. 1 To date , solar power conversion efficiencies ( PCE ) of 10.6% and 9.2% have been demonstrated in the cells with tandem and single junction structures , respectively , representing an important advance in the development of PSCs. 2 Many recent research efforts have been concentrated on the development of donor - acceptor ( D-A ) narrow band gap ( NBG ) polymers with broad absorption spectra. 3 Despite the great success of these D-A polymers in achieving high performance PSCs , further development of novel electron donor polymers is still in urgent need as the donor polymers play a decisive role in determining the device performance. Nowadays , most of the present polymers are in main - chain D-A frame , which may suffer from lower hole mobility due to the influence of acceptor units in the main chain. Aiming at investigating the effects of the D-A framework on device performance , Huang and co-workers proposed a new molecular design strategy toward side - chain D-A conjugated polymers , in which D moieties were employed to construct the main chain and A units were conjugatedly pended onto the D units in the side chain. 4 Compared to the corresponding main - chain D-A polymers , the side - chain ones mainly possesses three advantages. First , the highest occupied molecular orbit ( HOMO ) energy levels of the side - chain polymers can preserve in a deeper position. Second , a two - dimensional - like structural feature renders this class of polymers with better solubility. Finally , there exists an internal charge transfer ( ICT ) behavior from the side - chain D-A structure , which can fine - tune the band gap ( E g ) of the resultant polymers as well as promote an isotropic charge transport along the polymeric main chain. As a result of these merits , PSCs based on these previously reported side - chain D-A polymers exhibited a maximal PCE of 4.74% .

Let's think step by step.

1. PBDT-TDPP-S:
 * PBDT: Poly(benzo[1,2-b:4,5-b′]dithiophene)
 * TDPP: 2,5-bis(3-dodecylthiophen-2-yl)thiophene
 * S: Side chain
2. PC71BM:
 * PC71BM: [6,6]-phenyl-C71-butyric acid methyl ester
3. PSCs: Polymer solar cells
4. D-A: Donor-acceptor
5. NBG: Narrow band gap
6. HOMO: Highest occupied molecular orbit
7. E g: Band gap
8. ICT: Internal charge transfer
Please remove irrelevant entities and only keep the entities that clearly refer to Property Name of Material.

Sure, here are the entities that clearly refer to Property Name of Material:

1. PBDT-TDPP-S
2. PC71BM
3. PSCs
4. D-A
5. NBG
6. HOMO
7. E g

I have removed the following entities as they do not clearly refer to Property Name of Material:

1. "Poly(benzo[1,2-b:4,5-b′]dithiophene)" (this is a description of the material, not a property name)
2. "2,5-bis(3-dodecylthiophen-2-yl)thiophene" (this is a description of the material, not a property name)
3. "side chain" (this is a description of the material's structure, not a property name)
4. "donor-acceptor" (this is a description of the material's function, not a property name)
5. "band gap" (this is a property of the material, but it is not a specific name of a property)
6. "internal charge transfer" (this is a description of the material's behavior, not a property name)

Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Property Name".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

Sure, here are the valid entities presented as a Markdown table with one column "Property Name":

| Property Name |
| --- |
| PBDT-TDPP-S |
| PC71BM |
| PSCs |
| D-A |
| NBG |
| HOMO |
| E g |

Please identify the Values (number + unit) of material properties in the following paragraph.

Paragraph: A novel conjugated polymer of PBDT-TDPP-S was synthesized , which contains a donor unit of benzo [1,2b:4,5-b′]dithiophene in main chain and an acceptor unit of diketopyrrolopyrrole in side chain. This kind of side - chain donor - acceptor ( D-A ) polymer exhibited better solution processability , lower HOMO level ( -5.34 eV ) , and more balanced carrier mobility relative to its corresponding mainchain D-A conjugated polymers. Finally , there exists an internal charge transfer ( ICT ) behavior from the side - chain D-A structure , which can fine - tune the band gap ( E g ) of the resultant polymers as well as promote an isotropic charge transport along the polymeric main chain. As a result of these merits , PSCs based on these previously reported side - chain D-A polymers exhibited a maximal PCE of 4.74% .

Let's think step by step.

1. First, let's identify the material properties mentioned in the paragraph:

* HOMO level
* Carrier mobility
* Open-circuit voltage
* Short-circuit current
* Fill factor
* Power conversion efficiency
2. Next, let's look at each sentence and identify the values (number + unit) of these material properties:

* "This kind of side-chain donor-acceptor (D-A) polymer exhibited better solution processability, lower HOMO level (−5.34 eV), and more balanced carrier mobility relative to its corresponding mainchain D-A conjugated polymers."
 + HOMO level: −5.34 eV
* "The resulting polymer solar cells exhibited outstanding photovoltaic properties with a power conversion efficiency of 4.89% , an open-circuit voltage of 0.84 V , a short-circuit current of 10.04 mA cm^-2 , and a fill factor of 56.0% ."
 + Power conversion efficiency: 4.89%
 + Open-circuit voltage: 0.84 V
 + Short-circuit current: 10.04 mA cm^-2
 + Fill factor: 56.0%
* "To date , solar power conversion efficiencies (PCE) of 10.6% and 9.2% have been demonstrated in the cells with tandem and single junction structures , respectively , representing an important advance in the development of PSCs."
 + Power conversion efficiency (tandem junction): 10.6%
 + Power conversion efficiency (single junction): 9.2%
* "Despite the great success of these D-A polymers in achieving high performance PSCs , further development of novel electron donor polymers is still in urgent need as the donor polymers play a decisive role in determining the device performance."
* "Aiming at investigating the effects of the D-A framework on device performance , Huang and co-workers proposed a new molecular design strategy toward side-chain D-A conjugated polymers , in which D moieties were employed to construct the main chain and A units were conjugatedly pended onto the D units in the side chain."
* "Compared to the corresponding main-chain D-A polymers , the side-chain ones mainly possesses three advantages. First , the highest occupied molecular orbit (HOMO) energy levels of the side-chain polymers can preserve in a deeper position."
 + HOMO energy level (side-chain polymers): deeper position
* "Second , a two-dimensional-like structural feature renders this class of polymers with better solubility."
* "Finally , there exists an internal charge transfer (ICT) behavior from the side-chain D-A structure , which can fine-tune the band gap (Eg) of the resultant polymers as well as promote an isotropic charge transport along the polymeric main chain."
 + Band gap (Eg): fine-tunable
3. Therefore, the material properties mentioned in the paragraph are:

* HOMO level (−5.34 eV)
* Carrier mobility
* Open-circuit voltage (0.84 V)
* Short-circuit current (10.04 mA cm^-2)
* Fill factor (56.0%)
* Power conversion efficiency (4.89%, 10.6%, 9.2%)
* HOMO energy level (deeper position)
* Solubility
* Band gap (Eg) (fine-tunable)
* Isotropic charge transport
